title: Which movie character do you think you resemble? - Quora

response.answer_text: Kanji bhai (Paresh Rawal) from the movie Oh My God!  The first time I saw this movie, I thought ― he is exactly like me. He is an atheist, and his thinking and mine ― questioning everything related to God ― was too identical. Not just me, some of my close ones thought the same as well. So, this character is more or less me, except his age. :P I am almost the same. I keep questioning about the existence of God and all these religious beliefs that people are following religiously (or blindly). I am practical, and there is no expectation of magic from any super power. I don’t believe in afterlife. I have no fear of God, and I don’t believe God or anyone else has any control over us or any other thing in this world. It is as simple as that for me. When I die, and if there is no one to keep my name, what is a big deal in that? Who cares what happens after I'm gone forever? One of the famous dialogues from this movie, which matches my thinking is: Main sab dharmon ka aadar karta hoon ... aur kisi bhi dharm mein maanta nahin. (I respect all religions ... and don't believe in any religion.) I see no reason why someone should tell me how to live my life, not even God. I decide for myself. Good or bad, it’s my life, and I have got my brain and heart to decide for myself. With that, I say this again: There is no better religion than humanity and there is no God better than your humble self. Choice is clear, my choice.  Smiles! ☺:) ([math]\ddot\smile[/math]) Shail 'The Atheist Flash'

I am basically a mix of two characters: Ved Vardhan Sahini from Tamasha.  And. Ayan Sanger from Ae Dil Hai Mushkil.  Just like Ved. I am a storyteller. He talks to mountains, enacts various roles, makes up stories and narrates them to people and entertains them. As a kid, Ved shows all signs of a master storyteller in the film. Though I am not a master storyteller, just like Ved from Tamasha. I too did all those things as a kid, and continue to do so now. Wherever I go to any social gathering, everyone assembles around whilst I tell a story, a story I made up based on real incidents mostly. I narrate whatever is in my mind and most people are interested in it. And just like Ved from Tamasha, I too talk to mountains, walls and enact situations and characters mostly in front of the mirror as I can’t go to Corsica just yet. And just like Ayan from Ae Dil Hai Mushkil. I too am a sensitive introvert. There is a scene in ADHM, where Ayan tells Alizeh how he was seen as a ajeebo (Weird) introvert and that he had no great friends in school and the label of a weird introvert frankly made no difference to him. That’s almost exactly similar to me. I too was labelled as a ajeebo in my school, and I still am a big introvert. And just like Ayan, I am extremely sensitive in real life (not on Quora). And yes I have been friendzoned multiple times like Ayan was! I share many other similarities with both Ved and Ayan. The only similarity I don’t share is obviously the looks. Ved and Ayan are extremely good looking, I am not. Besides that, these characters are almost autobiographical in nature for me. I don’t know why Ranbir choose these characters (he looks to me like an introvert too). But its because of these characters, that I am his biggest fan. I could instantly connect to Ved from the second he appeared on screen, same with Ayan.
